questions.question: Suddenly we noticed that the clock ………………
questions.description: A past tense in the principal clause should be followed by a past tense in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: I never thought that I ………………… see him again.
questions.description: Would is the past tense of will. A past tense in the principal clause should be followed by a past tense in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: The woman led me to her hut and …………….. me to remain there for the night.
questions.description: A past tense in the principal clause should be followed by a past tense in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: We …………….. higher so that we might get a better view of the procession.
questions.description: The past tense in the subordinate clause clearly indicates that the main verb is in the past tense.

questions.question: Euclid proved that the three angles of a triangle …………….. equal to two right angles.
questions.description: A past tense in the main clause may be followed by a present tense in the subordinate clause when the subordinate clause expresses a universal truth.

questions.question: I will nurse him so that he …………….. live.
questions.description: When the verb in the principal clause is in the present or future, we use a present tense in the subordinate clause to indicate purpose.

questions.question: I will call you when I …………….
questions.description: When the verb in the principal clause is in the present or future, we use a present tense in the subordinate clause to indicate purpose.

questions.question: He went to the city so that he …………… find work.
questions.description: Might is the past tense form of may. A past tense in the main clause is usually followed by a past tense in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: Wherever he preached, people ……………….. to listen.
The thieves stole whatever they ……………… find in the house.
questions.description: A past tense in the principal clause should be followed by a past tense in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: He came oftener than we ……………… him to.
questions.description: A past tense in the principal clause should be followed by a past tense in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: He stayed at home because he ……………. feeling ill.
questions.description: A past tense in the principal clause should be followed by a past tense in the subordinate clause.
